history.content: You may wish to look into Hug and Denero's 1 unit upper dub about social implications of CS  (does not count for the requirement http://www.eecs.berkeley.edu/csugrad/index.shtml)
You may wish to look into Hug and Denero's 1 unit upper dub about social implications of CS

children.subject: @Kunal, Hug and Denero's Social Implications of Computing doesn't count as an upperdiv since it's not technical in nature. See http://www.eecs.berkeley.edu/csugrad/index.shtml.

history.content: It's my final semester here, and I'm currently taking a 3 unit grad cs course, 6 units of non-cs, and will be adding 4 units of CS199 research. The problem is that with my current schedule, I'll be missing exactly 1 unit for the CS requirement (I'm at 26 total CS upperdiv units). I'm really enjoying my current schedule, and was wondering what my options were in this case? I don't want to switch my 3 unit class for a 4 unit class since I'm really enjoying this class and it's useful for my research, and I don't think it would make sense to add another 3/4 units of upperdiv CS just to cover that 1 unit since this will take time away from research. I was wondering if I could get some suggestions on this and the available options. Thanks so much!
history.subject: Missing one unit of CS
